member.name: IDirectDrawGammaControl.GetGammaRamp
member.summary: Retrieves the red, green, and blue gamma ramps for the primary surface.
member.param: Currently not used and must be set to 0.

A pointer to a structure that receives the current red, green, and blue gamma ramps. Each array maps color values in the frame buffer to the color values to be passed to the digital-to-analog converter (DAC).

returns.para: If the method succeeds, the return value is DD_OK.
If it fails, the method can return one of the following error values:

member.name: IDirectDrawGammaControl.SetGammaRamp
member.summary: Sets the red, green, and blue gamma ramps for the primary surface.
member.param: Flag that indicates whether gamma calibration is required. Set this parameter to DDSGR_CALIBRATE to request that the calibrator adjust the gamma ramp according to the physical properties of the display, which makes the result identical on all computers. If calibration is not needed, set this parameter to 0.

A pointer to a structure that contains the new red, green, and blue gamma ramp entries. Each array maps color values in the frame buffer to the color values to be passed to the digital-to-analog converter (DAC).

returns.para: If the method succeeds, the return value is DD_OK.

member.name: IDirectDrawGammaControl
member.summary: Applications use the methods of the IDirectDrawGammaControl interface to adjust the red, green, and blue gamma ramp levels of the primary surface. This section is a reference to the methods of this interface.
